text: Bedok Town Park is a narrow but long strip of park space between Bedok North MRT Station and Bedok Reservoir MRT Station, and parallel to the PIE. There is a Dog Run, an Allotment Garden, and a Play Corridor; and I saw at least 4 pedestrian bridges linking the park to the HDB flats across the PIE. If not for the noise of the vehicles coming from the expressway, I would say that it is an excellent park to be in. Certainly envy the residents staying in those blocks just next to the park.

Less well known park covered with lush green. Good for kids who like sand play as it a few sand pits. We saw many grass hoppers. Interesting place for city kids to get know nature. The park is liner that will be good place to peddle bikes
